title: Question 1
question: The skeleton of the neck is formed by:

options.label: Cervical vertebrae, hyoid bone, external manubrium and clavicles
Cervical vertebrae, external manubrium, clavicles and scapulae
Cervical vertebrae, hyoid bone, external manubrium and scapulae
Cervical vertebrae, atlas, hyoid bone and clavicles

title: Question 2
question: The mobile hyoid bone is located:

options.label: Back of the neck, at the vertebral level of C2 (axis), at the angle between the mandible and the cricoid cartilage
Anterior part of the neck, at the C3 vertebral level, at the angle between the mandible and the thyroid cartilage
Back of the neck, at the vertebral level of C3, at the angle between the mandible and the cricoid cartilage
Anterior part of the neck, at the vertebral level of C2 (axis), at the angle between the mandible and the thyroid cartilage

title: Question 3
question: There are 03 superficial and lateral neck muscles, they are:

title: Question 4
question: The lateral cervical trigone is usually formed by the pre-vertebral fascia that extends over 04 muscles, which are:

options.label: Sternocleidomastoid, scapular lifter, middle and posterior scalene
Sternocleidomastoid, scapular lifter, mentual and trapezius
Splenic head, scapular lifter, mental and trapezius
Head splenium, scapular lifter, middle and posterior scalene

title: Question 5
question: Among the following structures, which is located in the occipital trigone?

title: Question 6
question: Among the structures below, which is not located in the omoclavicular triangle?

title: Question 7
question: Among the following structures, which is not located in the submandibular triangle?

title: Question 8
question: Among the following structures, which is located in the submental triangle?

title: Question 9
question: Among the following structures, which is not located in the carotid triangle?

title: Question 10
question: Among the following structures, which is not located in the muscle triangle?

title: Question 11
question: The root of the neck is limited laterally, anteriorly and posteriorly by:

options.label: the 1st pair of ribs and their costal cartilages, by the external manubrium and by the vertebral body t1
the 2nd pair of ribs and their costal cartilages, the external manubrium and the vertebral body t2
the 3rd pair of ribs and their costal cartilages, by the external manubrium, and by the vertebral body t3
the 4th pair of ribs and their costal cartilages, the external manubrium and the t4 vertebral body

title: Question 12
question: Of the following arteries, which is not located at the root of the neck?

title: Question 13
question: Of the following muscles, which is not related to neck movement?

title: Question 14
question: There are two large veins that end at the root of the neck, they are:

options.label: External jugular vein anterior jugular vein
Internal jugular vein and posterior jugular vein
External jugular vein and posterior jugular vein
Internal jugular vein and anterior jugular vein

title: Question 15
question: Which of the following structures do not correspond to the viscera of the neck?

title: Question 16
question: The thyroid gland is located:

options.label: It is located anteriorly to the sternothyroid and sternohyoid muscles, at the level of vertebrae C4 to T2. And its lobes are located postero-proximal to the larynx and trachea
It is located anteriorly to the sternothyroid and sternohyoid muscles, at the level of vertebrae C5 to T1. And its lobes are located posterolateral to the larynx and trachea
It is located deep in the sternothyroid and sternohyoid muscles, at the level of vertebrae C4 to T2. And its lobes are located antero-proximal to the larynx and trachea
It is located deep in the sternothyroid and sternohyoid muscles, at the level of vertebrae C5 to T1. And its lobes are located anterolateral to the larynx and trachea

title: Question 17
question: Which of the following laryngeal muscles is responsible for stretching and tensioning the vocal fold?

title: Question 18
question: Of the following muscles, which one does not correspond to a pharynx muscle?

title: Question 19
question: The pharynx extends:

options.label: From the apex of the mouth to the upper margin of the cricoid cartilage, posteriorly, and the upper margin of the C6 vertebra, anteriorly
From the apex of the mouth to the lower margin of the cricoid cartilage, anteriorly, and the upper vertebra C6, posteriorly
From the base of the skull to the lower margin of the cricoid cartilage, anteriorly, and the lower margin of the C6 vertebra, posteriorly
From the base of the skull to the lower margin of the cricoid cartilage, posteriorly, and the lower margin of the C6 vertebra, anteriorly

title: Question 20
question: The cavity of the larynx is divided into three parts, which are:

options.label: Upper portion, middle portion and lower portion
Larynx vestibule, laryngeal ventricle and infraglottic cavity
Larynx vestibule, laryngeal ventricle and oral cavity
